intro: Chlanis tettensis, commonly known as the Tettens Island orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Tettens in the South Pacific. It is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has strap-like leaves and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is classified within the Orchidaceae family, known for its diverse and often showy floral structures. Due to habitat loss, Chlanis tettensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
